channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Street light out, 11th August
item.description:
The light on the corner of Hewlett Road and 1 Berkeley Place GL52 6DB is out.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hewlett Road, Tivoli, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Barley growing across the path, 10th August
item.description:
The trodden path in the picture is not on the public footpath. It must be cleared to a width of at least one metre, running past the telegraph pole. It must be done before the crop is harvested. This is the Winchcombe Way, a popular route.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rushley Lane, Winchcombe, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown vegetation at the entrance to the cart track going from the end of the Cold Slad road to the farm below., 10th August
item.description:
The start of the track by Journeys End. This track has been in continuous use by walkers for many years but doesn’t appear on your map as a Public Right of Way. Further down the same track the path crosses a stream and there is a Public Footpath sign visible but fence posts being put up suggest this access might be compromised. We’re not sure what the legal position is on access to this route being maintained.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dog Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree blocking footpath and vegetation makes walking the path impossible without brandishing sticks to clear brambles, nettles and overhanging shrubs, 10th August
item.description:
The public footpath that joins the ‘u bend’ at the top of Dog Lane with the Cold Slad road (known locally as Jacobs Ladder). We did eventually fight our way through but with great difficulty.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A417 Missing Link, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large, wide pothole, 10th August
item.description:
Between edge of Down Hatherley and Dowry. Shallow but maybe 2ft wide
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Frog Furlong Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken paving, 10th August
item.description:
Close to 99 High St, Cheltenham GL50 1DP in the middle of the pavement. Possible collision with bollard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 91-97, High Street, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Edge of road collapse, 10th August
item.description:
The edge of the road has collapsed and needs repair I’m sharing a what3words address to help you find this specific location. Tap to see exactly where it is: ///focus.mixing.evenly https://w3w.co/focus.mixing.evenly
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Main Road
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown trees, 10th August
item.description:
On Land adjacent to 15 Golden Miller Road, GL50 4RD, these two sycamore trees are grossly overgrown, I am concerned to potential damage to my property, and would like some essential maintenance done to make the trees less of a nuisance to my drains & rain water gutters. The height is excessive and would like them pruned so that I can have solar panels installed to my roof, to use green energy. The trees are in excess of 35ft tall. Every winter they also deposit massive amounts of seeds that cause drain blockages and slippery pavements. Please help.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Golden Miller Road, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Whole pavement in this area needs redoing as damaged/ broken. An elderly person fell on it last week!!, 10th August
item.description:
Hedge outside 19 Greenhills road. Pavement is regularily used by elderly people and people with pushchairs. It si so broken someone tripped on it last week and got badly hurt hence needs attention ASAP

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Greenhills Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bishops Drive, Tewkesbury

Elm Farm Play Area

item.title: Repeat problem of more tarmac needed to level path, 10th August
item.description:
See photos on how the weeds are growing g up from the cracked tarmac. This is casing a ' hedge' on the curb side of the path next to the road. It is proving a hazard to walkers, joggers a d cyclists. I think now is the season to get this work underway please. Location is Up Hatherley Way next to lamp number 22.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Up Hatherley Way, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Possible sinkhole reappearing on Leckhampton Road, 10th August
item.description:
160 Leckhampton Road GL53 0DH Large sinkhole that has been repaired previously. This is sinking again and road surface has now also cracked. High volumes of traffic on this road and potentially a serious safety hazard .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 160, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole on southbound carriageway on nearside, 9th August
item.description:
Nearside pothole adjacent to parking section on left. Also a secondary pothole approx 100yds further up the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 61, All Saints' Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole on Leckhampton Road, 9th August
item.description:
On the road near 160 Leckhampton Road GL53 0DH. This is a very large pot hole that has been repaired numerous times. It’s sinking again and the road surface has now cracked . On a major road into Cheltenham with extremely high volumes of traffic that will become a significant safety hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 160, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin lorry has damaged pavement again!, 9th August
item.description:
The bin lorry has damaged the pavement again outside my house, it was only fixed for the 5th time yesterday. Who ever is doing the repairs just scrapes off the tarmac and refills…. As per the last time it was damaged this needs properly fixing and firming up underneath. You are just wasting money at this point doing the same thing over and over.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Millham Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole, 9th August
item.description:
It has had a white line painted round it a few months ago but nothing has happened. It’s on a bend in Brockhampton lane just past the GE aviation on the way to Brockhampton village.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockhampton Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Looks like two smashed windscreens., 9th August
item.description:
Dangerous broken glass on the inside of small lay-by on the left hand side of Brockhampton lane just after level crossing on the way up to Swindon Village. Looks like at least two windscreens.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockhampton Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: General road marking and stud issues problem, 9th August
item.description:
Customer reports that vehicles are just parking in the electric car points and the vehicles are diesel and petrol. Which is stopping people with hybrids or electric cars from being able to charge their vehicles. Customer also reports that there are double yellow lines over one of the park spaces for the points, and is it okay for users of the power points to park over these lines when charging their vehicles. Are the old double yellow lines going to be removed, and new lining going to be put down to go around the parking space for the points?
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues
